definition: li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels

sentences.english: And I want to thank all of you for braving the cold and the crowds and traveling in some cases thousands of miles to join us here today.
sentences.chinese: 我要感謝冒着嚴寒千里迢迢趕來的人們。

sentences.english: You rode all the way from Persia for earth and water?
sentences.chinese: 你千里迢迢從波斯趕來，就是爲了土地和水？

sentences.english: People still travel to Buffalo today to experience the original wings.
sentences.chinese: 現在仍有人千里迢迢到水牛城來品嚐地道的原味雞翅。

sentences.english: You crossed thousands of miles and came to see me beyond my dreams.
sentences.chinese: 我做夢都沒想到你會千里迢迢來看我。

sentences.english: They travel far away to their new schools, and are determined to settle in on their own.
sentences.chinese: 他們千里迢迢來到新學校，決心靠自己獨立安頓下來。

definition: make light of traveling a thousand li/go to the trouble of traveling a long distance
(adverbial phrase used with verbs such as 歸|归[gui1] or 赴[fu4] etc) traveling a great distance
to travel over land and water (idiom)
to suffer untold hardships (idiom); trials and tribulations/with difficulty/after some effort
to muster large forces/to get a great number of people involved (in carrying out some task)
to pass over mountains ridges (idiom); fig. hardships of the journey
